risk: Complete dependency on ParentCo infrastructure creates complex separation requirements
trigger: Full integration strategy requiring complete separation from ParentCo systems
impact_description: Requires building entirely new infrastructure stack, extended TSA period, potential business disruption during cutover
mitigation: Negotiate extended TSA (18-24 months), phase migration approach, consider hybrid model initially

risk: Azure AD tenant mismatch between ParentCo and BuyerCo
trigger: Need to migrate 650 users from ParentCo Azure AD to BuyerCo Azure AD
impact_description: Complex user migration, potential access disruption, application re-authentication required, loss of historical identity data
cost_impact_estimate: $200K-$500K for identity migration and application reconfiguration
mitigation: Plan phased identity migration, implement identity bridging solutions, extensive testing of SSO integrations

risk: Shared ERP/CRM/HCM platforms require data separation and potential system replacement
trigger: TargetCo operates within shared enterprise platforms that cannot be easily carved out
impact_description: May require new system implementations, complex data migration, business process disruption, extended timeline
cost_impact_estimate: $1M-$10M+ depending on system complexity and customizations
mitigation: Assess data separation feasibility, evaluate BuyerCo system capacity for integration, consider phased approach

risk: Key person dependency risk for infrastructure knowledge
trigger: TargetCo has no independent IT infrastructure team - all knowledge resides with ParentCo
impact_description: Loss of institutional knowledge, delayed migration, increased consulting costs, potential system outages
cost_impact_estimate: $500K-$1M in additional consulting and remediation costs
mitigation: Immediate knowledge transfer sessions, documentation creation, retention bonuses for key ParentCo IT staff

risk: Complete network separation required from ParentCo with no independent network infrastructure
trigger: TargetCo has no standalone network assets and relies entirely on ParentCo's shared infrastructure
impact_description: Will require complete network buildout including WAN circuits, firewalls, switches, and network services - significant cost and timeline impact
mitigation: Immediately begin network discovery and circuit ordering process; establish temporary connectivity solutions for Day 1

risk: IP address conflicts between TargetCo and BuyerCo environments
trigger: Both environments likely use common RFC1918 address ranges (10.x.x.x or 192.168.x.x) creating overlap
impact_description: IP conflicts will prevent network connectivity and application access, blocking Day 1 operations and requiring extensive renumbering
mitigation: Immediate IP address discovery and conflict analysis; prepare IP renumbering plan with NAT as temporary solution

risk: WAN circuit lead times may delay integration timeline
trigger: New WAN circuits typically require 30-90 days for installation, and TargetCo currently has no independent connectivity
impact_description: Delays in circuit delivery will push back integration timeline and may require expensive temporary solutions
mitigation: Order circuits immediately upon deal announcement; establish temporary VPN connectivity for Day 1

risk: DNS and domain dependencies on ParentCo infrastructure
trigger: TargetCo likely uses ParentCo domain names and DNS services for business operations
impact_description: Email delivery, application access, and external communications may be disrupted during separation
mitigation: Establish new domain structure and DNS services; plan phased migration with mail routing during transition

risk: Complete dependency on ParentCo security infrastructure creates carve-out complexity
trigger: At deal close, TargetCo will lose access to ParentCo's Azure AD, SIEM, SOC, and all security tooling
impact_description: Complete loss of security monitoring, identity services, and incident response capability on Day 1, creating significant security exposure
mitigation: Establish standalone security infrastructure before carve-out or negotiate extended TSA for security services

risk: Identity integration complexity due to Azure AD tenant separation
trigger: Need to migrate 650 users from ParentCo Azure AD to BuyerCo Azure AD while maintaining access to applications
impact_description: User access disruption, potential security gaps during migration, application access issues, and MFA re-enrollment requirements
mitigation: Plan phased identity migration with hybrid authentication during transition period

risk: Loss of enterprise-grade security tooling and monitoring capabilities
trigger: Separation from ParentCo's CrowdStrike, Microsoft Sentinel SIEM, and centralized SOC operations
impact_description: Reduced threat detection, no 24/7 monitoring, potential compliance gaps, and increased incident response time
mitigation: Procure standalone security tooling or negotiate managed security services during transition

trigger: TargetCo may lose SOC 2 and ISO compliance coverage when separated from ParentCo
impact_description: Customer contract violations, inability to bid on regulated business, potential revenue loss, and audit costs
mitigation: Verify compliance scope and plan for independent certifications post-acquisition

risk: Unknown security posture and vulnerability exposure
trigger: No recent security assessments or penetration testing results provided for TargetCo environment
impact_description: Inheriting unknown vulnerabilities, potential breach exposure, and unexpected remediation costs
mitigation: Conduct pre-close security assessment and penetration testing

risk: Cumulative critical path timeline risk - three long-lead dependencies create 18+ month integration timeline
trigger: Azure AD migration (8-12 weeks) + WAN circuit procurement (12-16 weeks) + security infrastructure deployment (12-16 weeks) must be sequenced
impact_description: Deal timeline extends to 18-24 months, TSA costs increase significantly, integration complexity compounds
cost_impact_estimate: $2M-$4M in additional TSA and extended timeline costs
mitigation: Negotiate minimum 18-month TSA, begin long-lead procurement immediately upon LOI, establish parallel workstreams where possible

risk: Complete business disruption risk during Day 1 cutover
trigger: Simultaneous loss of ParentCo identity, network, and security services without fully operational BuyerCo alternatives
impact_description: Complete business shutdown for 650 users, inability to access critical systems, potential data loss
mitigation: Phased migration approach, maintain dual connectivity during transition, comprehensive Day 1 readiness testing
